person.persName: Rufus Somerby (Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier - 2nd Lt. 11th Ky. Cav.)

body.p: Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, clerk and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Rufus Somerby and Johana Somerby. Attended in school in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned three enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Clerk in Louisville in 1860. Household owned one enslaved person in Louisville in 1860. Clerk in Louisville in 1861. Served in the 9th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) a first lieutenant and captain from May 10, 1862 to June 10, 1863. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private, sergeant major, and second lieutenant from October 30, 1863 to July 2, 1865. Prisoner of War from July 31, 1864 to September 28, 1864. Charged with disobedience of orders at the Battle of Marion, Smyth County, Virginia, on December 18, 1864.
